ent.origin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Latin nidus, from the Indo-European bases of nether (meaning 'down') and sit.

p.def: A structure or place made or chosen by a bird for laying eggs and sheltering its young:
p.eg: First, the flight trajectory will obviously depend on the way in which a bird will enter its nest site.

p.def: (Of a bird or other animal) use or build a nest:
p.eg: The owls often nest in barns.
